info.description:
# flowable / flowəb(ə)l /

- a compact and highly efficient workflow and Business Process Management (BPM) platform for developers, system admins and business users.
- a lightning fast, tried and tested BPMN 2 process engine written in Java. It is Apache 2.0 licensed open source, with a committed community.
- can run embedded in a Java application, or as a service on a server, a cluster, and in the cloud. It integrates perfectly with Spring. With a rich Java and REST API, it is the ideal engine for orchestrating human or system activities.
info.title: Flowable External Worker Job REST API

200.description: Indicates the jobs were acquired and locked.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights acquire the jobs.

post.summary: Complete an External Worker Job with a BPMN Error

204.description: Indicates the job was successfully completed.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights complete the job.

404.description: Indicates the job does not exist.

post.summary: Complete an External Worker Job with a cmmn terminate transition

204.description: Indicates the job was successfully transitioned.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights complete the job.

404.description: Indicates the job does not exist.

204.description: Indicates the job was successfully completed.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights complete the job.

404.description: Indicates the job does not exist.

204.description: Indicates the job was successfully completed.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights complete the job.

404.description: Indicates the job does not exist.

parameters.name: elementId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given elementId

parameters.name: elementName
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given elementName

parameters.name: exceptionMessage
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given exception message

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given executionId

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Only return job with the given id

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description: Only return jobs that are locked

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given processDefinitionId

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the processInstanceId

parameters.name: scopeDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given scopeDefinitionId

parameters.name: scopeId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given scopeId

parameters.name: subScopeId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given subScopeId

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return jobs with the given tenant id

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return jobs with a tenantId like the given value

parameters.name: unlocked
parameters.description: Only return jobs that are unlocked

parameters.name: withException
parameters.description: Only return jobs with an exception

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only return jobs without a tenantId

200.description: Indicates the requested jobs were returned.

400.description: Indicates an illegal value has been used in a url query parameter. Status description contains additional details about the error.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights to query for external worker jobs.

get.summary: Get a single external worker job

200.description: Indicates the requested job was returned.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have the rights access the job.

404.description: Indicates the requested job was not found.

topic.description: Acquire jobs with the given topic

lockDuration.description: The acquired jobs will be locked with this lock duration. ISO-8601 duration format PnDTnHnMn.nS with days considered to be exactly 24 hours.

numberOfTasks.description: The number of tasks that should be acquired. Default is 1.

numberOfRetries.description: The number of retries if an optimistic lock exception occurs during acquiring. Default is 5

workerId.description: The id of the external worker that would be used for locking the job

scopeType.description: Only acquire jobs with the given scope type

AcquireExternalWorkerJobRequest.description: Request that is used for acquiring external worker jobs

id.description: The id of the external job

url.description: The url of the external job

correlationId.description: The correlation id of the external job

processInstanceId.description: The process instance id for the external job

processDefinitionId.description: The process definition id for the external job

executionId.description: The execution id for the external job

scopeId.description: The scope id for the external job

subScopeId.description: The sub scope id for the external job

scopeDefinitionId.description: The scope definition id for the external job

scopeType.description: The scope type for the external job

elementId.description: The id of the element in the model

elementName.description: The name of the element in the model

exceptionMessage.description: The exception message for the job

dueDate.description: The due date for the job

createTime.description: The creation time of the job

tenantId.description: The tenant if of the job

lockOwner.description: The id of the lock owner. If not set then the job is not locked

lockExpirationTime.description: The time when the lock expires

variables.description: The variables from the scope of the job

workerId.description: The id of the external worker that executes the action. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently locked the job.

variables.description: The variables that should be passed to the job scope

ExternalWorkerJobCompleteRequest.description: Request that is used for completing external worker jobs

workerId.description: The id of the external worker that executes the action. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently locked the job.

variables.description: The variables that should be passed to the job scope

ExternalWorkerJobErrorRequest.description: Request that is used for completing external worker jobs with a bpmn error

workerId.description: The id of the external worker that reports the failure. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently locked the job.

retries.description: The new number of retries. If not set it will be reduced by 1. If 0 the job will be moved ot the dead letter table and would no longer be available for acquiring.

retryTimeout.description: The timeout after which the job should be made available again. ISO-8601 duration format PnDTnHnMn.nS with days considered to be exactly 24 hours.

ExternalWorkerJobFailureRequest.description: Request that is used for failing external worker jobs

id.description: The id of the external job

url.description: The url of the external job

correlationId.description: The correlation id of the external job

processInstanceId.description: The process instance id for the external job

processDefinitionId.description: The process definition id for the external job

scopeId.description: The scope id for the external job

subScopeId.description: The sub scope id for the external job

scopeDefinitionId.description: The scope definition id for the external job

scopeType.description: The scope type for the external job

exceptionMessage.description: The exception message for the job

dueDate.description: The due date for the job

createTime.description: The creation time of the job

tenantId.description: The tenant if of the job

lockOwner.description: The id of the lock owner. If not set then the job is not locked

lockExpirationTime.description: The time when the lock expires

workerId.description: The id of the external worker that executes the action. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently locked the job.

variables.description: The variables that should be passed to the job scope

ExternalWorkerJobTerminateRequest.description: Request that is used for terminating external worker jobs
